body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
To His Excellency Thos E. Bramlette
Gov. of the State of Kentucky

Your Petitioners would respectfully inform you that one William R. Matthis late a private of Co "B" 5th Ky. Cav. while belonging to said service was accused of horse stealing of which crime he was tried by the Monroe Circuit Court at its Oct. term 1865. found guilty and sentenced to confinement in the Penitentiary for the term of six years. Now Gov. this man is of such a nature that he could be persuaded by influential persons to do wrong which no doubt was the case, and as we think he has served long enough to make reparations for the crime We would most respectfully ask you to release him of said confinement. We would further say that as the last Legislature passed an act releasing all soldiers from Indictments found against them for crimes committed while in the service we think it nothing but justice that those already convicted should receive the benefit of the same act by you confering it upon them by the power vested in you by the constitution. Hoping you will consider the case & act as your best judgement dictates we remain your humble petitioners &c-
The following are names and acquaintances of said Matthis mostly living in Tennessee-

Tennesseans
James Croford
John Right
Late Lieut Co B. 5th Ky Cavalry
Geo W Clemens
Late Lieut Co F 1st Regiment
Tenn. Mounted Infty
Parrish Sims
Kentuckians
Bennet Spear
J peonkin
John B. Riggs
